text: Christiane N端sslein-Volhard (born October 20, 1942 in Magdeburg) is a German biologist and biochemist. She won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine in 1995 for her research on the genetic control of embryonic development which she shared with both Eric F. Wieschaus and Edward B. Lewis. She has an asteroid named after called 15811 N端sslein-Volhard. She started a foundation called the Christiane N端sslein-Volhard Foundation which helps young female German scientists with children. She was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1989. ==References== Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:German developmental biologists Category:German geneticists Category:German biochemists Category:German Nobel Prize winners Category:Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine winners Category:People from Magdeburg Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Christiane N端sslein-Volhard
